text:
Abbyville is a city in Reno County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 87 people lived there.
History.
Abbyville was a station on the Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway. The town was named after Abby McLean, the first baby born there.
The first post office in Abbyville was created in 1886. It was moved from Salt Creek.
Geography.
Abbyville is at (37.970619, -98.203764). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Weather.
Abbyville has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. According to the Köppen Climate Classification system, Abbyville has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 87 people, 42 households, and 29 families living in Abbyville.
